corrective, Arist. EN 1131a1; τὰ -κά, title of works on textual criticism by Seleucus and Crates, Sch. Il. Oxy. 221 xv 25, xvii 31. Adv. -κῶς Eust. 936.43.

definition: διορίζω, Ion. διουρίζω, Att. fut. -ῐῶ Pl. Lg. 860e: fut. Med. in pass. sense (v. infr. I.3):—

children.definition: draw a boundary through, delimit, separate, Hdt. 4.42; τὴν Εὐρώπην ἀπὸ τῆς Ἀσίης D.S. 1.55; δίχα δ. Pl. Sph. 267a: metaph., οὐ στενῷ τῷ ἰσθμῷ διώρισται ἡ ἱστορία πρὸς τὸ ἐγκώμιον Luc. Hist.Conscr. 7.

data.quote: οὐ στενῷ τῷ ἰσθμῷ διώρισται ἡ ἱστορία πρὸς τὸ ἐγκώμιον

children.definition: distinguish, determine, define, τὰ οὐνόματα Hdt. 4.45; θεοῖσι . . γέρα τίς ἄλλος ἢ ʼγὼ . . διώρισεν; A. Pr. 440; πτῆσιν οἰωνῶν . . διώρισα, of auguries, ib. 489; σῖτον δʼ εἰδέναι δ. so as to know it, Id. Fr. 182; γλυκὺν οἶνον καὶ οἰνώδεα Hp. Acut. 50; δ. ἀκούσιά τε καὶ ἑκούσια Pl. Lg. 860e, cf. Cra. 391d; δ. περὶ ἐνεργείας τί ἐστιν Arist. Metaph. 1048a26; define logically, δ. κατὰ τὰς διαφοράς Id. Top. 146b20, cf. EN 1103a3 ( Pass.), etc.:— Med., διορίζεσθαι τῷ στόματι τὰ γράμματα pronounce clearly, Alex. 301.

data.quote: θεοῖσι . . γέρα τίς ἄλλος ἢ ʼγὼ . . διώρισεν;

children.definition: determine, declare, τοιαῦτα φῆμαι μαντικαὶ διώρισαν S. OT 723: c. inf., determine one to be so and so, καθαρὸν διώρισεν εἶναι D. 20.158: with inf. omitted, οἱ συγγενεῖς μῆνές με μικρὸν καὶ μέγαν διώρισαν S. OT 1083:— Med., δηλοῖ καὶ δ. ὅτι . . D. 18.40; διορισαμένων ὅπως . . Id. 56.11; διορίσασθαι τίς αἱρετώτατος βίος Arist. Pol. 1323a15: pf. Pass. in med. sense, ἃ χρὴ ποιεῖν διωρίσμεθα D. 24.192:— Pass., διώρισται ὁπότερον . . And. 4.8; διωρισμένον it being prescribed, Lys. 30.4; τὸν νόμον ὡς ἐτέθη καὶ πρὸς οὓς διωρίσθη D. 59.93; ἐν τῷ διωρισμένῳ χρόνῳ PTeb. 105.33 (ii B. C.), etc.: impers., διοριεῖται περί τινος we will give precepts about . . , Hp. Art. 9; ἐν οἷς [λόγοις] διώρισται περὶ τῶν ἠθικῶν Arist. Pol. 1282b20, cf. EN 1136a10.

data.quote: οἱ συγγενεῖς μῆνές με μικρὸν καὶ μέγαν διώρισαν
τὸν νόμον ὡς ἐτέθη καὶ πρὸς οὓς διωρίσθη
ἐν οἷς [λόγοις] διώρισται περὶ τῶν ἠθικῶν

children.definition: draw distinctions, lay down definitions, οὐδʼ ὁτιοῦν διορίζων D. 21.104; τοῦτό μοι . . διόρισον Pl. Grg. 488d:—mostly in Med., δ. περί τινος And. 3.12, Isoc. 3.5, Arist. Ph. 200b15; πρὸς ἀλλήλους Pl. Grg. 457c; δίκην διωρίσω didst settle the conditions of the trial, Ar. Ach. 364.

children.label: II
children.definition: remove across the frontier, banish, ἔξω τῶν ὅρων Pl. Lg. 873e; τὸν ἐνθένδε πόλεμον εἰς τὴν ἤπειρον Isoc. 4.174; τινὰ ὑπὲρ θυμέλας E. Ion 46: generally, carry abroad, στράτευμα Τροίαν ἔπι Id. Hel. 394; δ. πόδα to depart, ib. 828.

data.quote: τὸν ἐνθένδε πόλεμον εἰς τὴν ἤπειρον

children.label: III
children.definition: send out a branch, of the Bosporus, Plb. 4.43.7.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Pass., to be discontinuous, opp. συνάπτω, Arist. Cat. 4b28; διωρισμένος, opp. συνεχής, ib. 20.
distinction, Pl. Lg. 777b; separation, Arist. Ph. 213b26.
ordinance, Porph. Abst. 1.7.
division, distinction, Pl. Ti. 38c, Arist. EN 1134b33, Porph. Abst. 3.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: logical distinction, Pl. Plt. 282c; definition, Arist. SE 168a23, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: particular enunciation of a problem, Procl. in Euc. p.203 F.
statement of limits of possibility of a problem, Apollon.Perg. Con.Praef., Archim. Sph.Cyl. 2.4, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.17 M.
one must distinguish, Pl. Lg. 874d, Arist. Ph. 204a2, Longin. 11.3, etc.
capable of distinguishing, S.E. M. 10.128: -ιστική (sc. τέχνη), ἡ, Syrian. in Metaph. 56.3.
limiting, Iamb. in Nic. pp. 88,89 P.
adjure, Sammelb. 4324.13:— Pass., of an oath, to be sworn, dub. in Wilcken Chr. 110 A 27 (ii B. C.).
assurance on oath, Plb. 16.26.6.
to be impelled, c. inf., θεῖν Max.Tyr. 41.5.
ὁρμίζω, τὰς ναῦς Longus 2.25:— Pass., D.S. 20.88: metaph., διορμίζεται ὁ βίος Hierocl. p.56 A.
hurry through, A. Supp. 552 (lyr.).
Hsch.; stone used in the game ἐφεδρισμός, Poll. 9.119.
turn into serum, Hp. Morb. 1.30, Gal. 19.93:— Pass., become serous, of the blood, Hp. Steril. 213, Arist. HA 521a13; of milk, ib. 521b34.
cut, canal, as that across the isthmus of Mount Athos, Th. 4.109.

children.label: II
children.definition: digging through, house-breaking, LXX Ex. 22.2(1), Je. 2.34.

children.label: III
children.definition: hole made in wall by χελώνη, Aen.Tact. 32.12.

children.label: IV
children.definition: siege-mine, D.S. 20.94.
battering-ram, Apollod. Poliorc. 138.19.
digging through, Sch. Theoc. 1.67.

dig through, διὰ τάφρον ὀρύξας having dug a trench across or along, Od. 21.120; τοῖχον δ., = τοιχωρυχέω, Hdt. 9.37, cf. Ar. Pl. 565, Th. 2.3, D. 54.37; δεσμωτήριον Id. 25.56; οἰκίαν X. Smp. 4.30, PPetr. 3p.60: c. acc. loci, τὸν Ἄθω Lys. 2.29, cf. Pl. Lg. 699a, D. 6.30: — Pass., Ev.Matt. 24.43.
undermine, ruin, D. 45.30; φιλίαν Lib. Or. 1.123; δημοκρατίαν Id. Decl. 1.41:— Pass., διορωρυγμένα δωροδοκίαις Plu. Phoc. 12, cf. Him. Ecl. 5.6 (but to be entrenched in our several cities, D. 9.28).

children.label: II
children.definition: worm out, ἀπόρρητα Bato 6; τὰ βουλευόμενα Plu. Util. 2.87c.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be shut up in a funeral vault, D.S. 4.43.
D. 7.40; φρεάτων Ph. 1.626; τοίχων Lib. Decl. 8.19: metaph., undermining, νόμων, δικαστηρίων, Id. Or. 63.21.
dance across or along, Opp. H. 5.440.

children.label: II
children.definition: dance a match, Ar. V. 1481.
becoming or making serous, Hp. Morb. 1.30.

definition: δῖος, δῖᾰ ( Hom., v. infr.), δῖον, fem. δίᾱ in E. Rh. 226 (lyr.), IT 404 (lyr.) ( δίη Hes. Th. 260 codd.); fem. δῖος E. Ba. 599 (anap.):—

children.definition: Ep., heavenly, δ. γένος Il. 9.538, etc., used by Hom.,
δῖα θεά 10.290; more freq. δῖα θεάων, with superl. force, 18.388, 19.6, etc.; δαίμονα δῖον Hes. Th. 991.
noble, Il. 2.221, etc.; δῖα γυναικῶν noblest of women, Od. 4.305; excellent, δ. ὑφορβός 16.20, al.
δῖοι Ἀχαιοί Il. 5.451; δ. Πελασγοί Od. 19.177; δ. ἑταῖροι Il. 5.692; of cities, as Elis, 2.615; Lacedaemon, Od. 3.326.
noble horse, Il. 8.185, 23.346.
divine, awful, marvellous, αἰθέρος ἐκ δίης, εἰς ἅλα δῖαν, χθὼν δῖα, Il. 16.365, 1.141, 14.347, cf. Emp. 109.2; δῖον πῦρ E. Alc. 5, etc.; δῖα Χάρυβδις Od. 12.104.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. of Ζεύς, Δ. βούλευμα A. Pr. 619; Δ. ὄμμα, στόμα, ib. 654, 1033, etc. (For dǐv-ǐyos, cf. Skt. div-yá-ʼheavenly’ (freq. trisyll.), but fem. δῖα for div-ya.)

definition: Δῖος, ὁ (sc. μήν), the first month of the Maced. year, PEleph. 1.2 (iv B. C.), J. BJ 2.19.9, etc.; in Aetolia, SIG 2845.1; in Thessaly, IG 9(1).689.8 (found in Corc.).
διοσ-, the first element in various compound names of plants: διόσανθος, διοσβάλανος, διοσαλακάτη, διοσκύαμος, διόσπυρον, διοσπώγων (qq. v.)

children.definition: carnation, Dianthus inodorus, Thphr. HP 6.1.1, al., Nic. Fr. 74.59.
sweet chestnut, Castanea vesca, Thphr. HP 4.5.1, al., Dsc. 1.106.
Dsc. 3.94; = περιστερεὼν ὕπτιος, Id. 4.60.
fruit of nettle-tree, Celtis australis, Thphr. HP 3.13.3:—but διόσ-πυρος, ὁ, = λιθόσπερμον, Dsc. 3.141.

worshippers of Zeus Atabyrios, IG 12(1).161 ( Rhodes):—also Διοσξεινιασταί or Διοσξενιασταί, worshippers of Zeus Xenios, ibid.: Διοσσωτηριασταί, οἱ, worshippers of Zeus Soter, ib. 162: Διοσμειλῐχιασταί, οἱ, worshippers of Zeus Meilichios, IG 12 (3).104 ( Nisyros).
given by Zeus, heaven-sent, αἴγλα Pi. P. 8.96; σκῆπτρα A. Eu. 626; γάνος Id. Ag. 1391 (Porson): in Id. Th. 946 the metre requires Διοδότων.
Lyd. Ost. 47.
portent-bearing, ἀστέρες Lyd. Ost. 15.

a sign from Zeus, an omen from the sky, esp. of thunder, lightning, rain, διοσημία ʼστί Ar. Ach. 171: pl., Stoic. 2.203, D.S. 2.19, Plu. Def.orac. 2.419e, Philostr. VA 2.33, Jul. Or. 7.212b. (Freq. written -εία in codd.)

definition: Διοσθεών, ὁ, name of a month at Stratonicea, BCH 44.71.
Διόσθυος, ὁ, name of a month in Rhodes, IG 12(1).155.1; Thera, Test.Epict. 4.1, cf. Call. ap. EM 278.28.

children.definition: look earnestly at, Anacr. 3; also expld. by διαφορεῖσθαι τῷ σώματι καὶ τῇ ψυχῇ, διαπολέσαι, διαφθεῖραι, Hsch.
temple of the Dioscuri, Th. 4.110 ( -κουρ- codd.), D. 19.158, etc.:—also Διοσκούριον, PPetr. 3p.295 (iii B. C.), IG ΙΙ(2).154 A 37 ( Delos, iii B. C.): Διοσκούρειον, Plu. Sull. 33, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Διοσκούρεια, τά, festival of the Dioscuri, IG 5(1).559 ( Sparta): -κορήϊα SIG 2438.175 (Delph.): -κούρια SIG 1067.15 ( Rhodes).

definition: Διοσκόριος, ὁ, name of a month in Syria, cj. in LXX 2 Ma. 11.21; in Crete, Hemerolog.Flor.
Διόσκοροι (the Att. form, Phryn. 212), Ion. and later Διόσκουροι, οἱ,

children.definition: the sons of Zeus, i.e. the twins of Leda, Castor and Polydeuces, h.Hom. 33.1, etc.: dual Διοσκόρω, τώ, Ar. Pax 285, Ec. 1069, E. Or. 465, Amphis 9, Men. 846, Them. Or. 21.253d: sg. dub. in Hippon. 120, cf. Varr. LL 5.66: Διόσκοροι is required by metre in E. Hel. 1643, El. 1239: -κούρων Pl. Euthd. 293a; -κόρων Id. Lg. 796b, cod. Laur. in Th. 3.75: both forms in codd. of Hdt. 2.43, 6.127.

children.label: II
children.definition: the Twins, Eratosth. Cat. 10.
guild of worshippers of Dioscuri, Arch.Pap. 5.158 (iii B. C.).
transmitting smells, ἀήρ EM 136.23, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Sens. 89.2, Them. in de An. 62.32.
double-boned, Arist. HA 494a5.
give a smell to, perfume, Sch. Ar. Ra. 1107.

definition: διότι, Conj. for διὰ τοῦτο ὅτι . . (cf. A.D. Conj. 242.1),

children.definition: because, for the reason that, since, Hdt. 1.44, 3.55, Th. 1.52, Thphr. Char. 17.4; οὐδὲ διʼ ἓν ἄλλο ἢ διότι . . Pl. Phd. 100c; answering to διὰ τί; Id. Plt. 310d, Amphis 14.6, Timocl. 2.4 D., etc.
wherefore, for what reason, φράσω διότι . . Hdt. 2.24; σκοπεῖν διότι . . Th. 1.77; ἐρωτᾶν διότι . . Henioch. 4.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: that, Hdt. 2.43, 50, Isoc. 4.48, D. 12.18, Is. 3.50, Arist. Metaph. 1062a6, al., Phld. Ir. p.84 W.; τὸ δ. Arist. APr. 53b9: folld. by inf., Plb. 31.12.4, v.l. in D.S. 4.76.
for whatever reason, Simp. in Ph. 50.20.
because, Iamb. in Nic. p.83 P.
fostered, cherished by Zeus, βασιλῆες Il. 2.196, Hes. Th. 82, etc.; αἰζηοί Il. 2.660; also of the Scamander, fed by rain, 21.223. (Cf. Διειτρεφής.)
nurse of Zeus, Κρήτα E. Hyps.Fr. 3 iii 23 (lyr.).
weight of two ounces, IGRom. 1.668 ( Tomi): written διούγγιον, Orib. Fr. 88.
cultivate (metaph.), Klio 18.302 (Delph.).
pass in urine, τι Dsc. Eup. 2.65:— Pass., Hp. Aër. 7: hence, to have diuretic properties, Id. Aff. 48.

children.label: II
children.definition: pass urine, Id. Aër. 9.
diuretic, Hp. Acut. 50, Diocl. Fr. 112, Aret. CA 1.1, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: percolate, Orib. Fr. 97.

definition: διοφανής, dub. l. (for δια-), Them. Or. 4.60d.

children.definition: irrigation-works, Str. 10.2.19.
furnish with channels, σῶμα Pl. Ti. 77c.
distribute by conduits, Luc. VH 1.33:— Pass., διωχετευμένων ὑδάτων D.S. 20.8: metaph. of the spinal cord, δ. διὰ τῶν σφονδύλων Ruf. Anat. 7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., of a country, to be irrigated, Str. 5.1.5.
to be impregnated, διὰ φωτός Plu. in Hes. 84 (prob. for διοιχηθείσῃ).
distance, interval, Ph. Bel. 75.6.

annoy exceedingly, πόλεις Lys. 6.6; weary, bore, D. 19.329: pf. διώχληκα Jul. Or. 2.78b; press for payment, POxy. 286.13 (i A. D.); later, τινί Aeschin. Ep. 2.2, Plu. Cim. 18, Longus 3.20: abs., Ph. 1.356:— Pass., Luc. Am. 50, IG 3.48 (iii A. D.); ὑπὸ ῥυθμῶν D.H. Comp. 11.
annoyance, IG 3.48 (iii A. D.).
move asunder, open, Nic. Al. 226 (tm.).

definition: διοχυρόω, strengthd. for ὀχυρόω, Plb. 5.46.3 ( Pass.).

children.definition: a view through, Plu. Aet. phys. 2.915a; transparency, ib. Pyth. 408e: metaph., ἤθους Id. Comp.Dem.Cic. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: consideration, Pl. Ti. 40d codd. ( διʼ ὄψεως Procl.).
with two children, A. Supp. 319: Cypr. δίπας, Inscr.Cypr. 93 H.
δ. θρῆνος a dirge chanted by oneʼs two children, A. Ch. 334 (lyr.).
two palms broad or long, X. Cyn. 2.4, Plb. 27.11.2:—also δῐπᾰλαιστιαῖος, α, ον, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.8.6, Gp. 9.10.2.

brandished with both hands, ξίφη E. IT 323; δ. πῦρ lightning hurled by Zeus with both hands, i.e. with all his might, Id. Tr. 1103 (lyr.); πᾶς . . στρατὸς δίπαλτος ἄν με χειρὶ φονεύοι all the host would kill me with sword brandished in both hands, i.e. with all their might, S. Aj. 408 (lyr.).
with double soles, Edict.Diocl. 9.12a, 15.
consisting of two members of 2 1/2 feet (sc. μέτρον), Heph. 15.10; κῶλα Sch. Ar. Pax 775:—also -μερικός, ή, όν, Sacerd. p. 512 K.

definition: διπηχυαῖος, α, ον, = sq., Dsc. 1.28, S.E. M. 8.459.

children.definition: two cubits long, broad, etc., Hdt. 2.78, Hp. Art. 7, etc.
double, poet. for διπλάσιος, AP 11.158 ( Antip. (?)).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. δ., τό, a measure of wine, Sammelb. 4425ii9, al.
double, φόρον And. 4.11 (s. v. l.), Alex. 122: — Pass., to be doubled, στρατηλάταις δορὸς διπλάζεται τιμά E. Supp. 781 (lyr.), cf. Men. 319.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be twofold or double, τό τοι διπλάζον μεῖζον κακόν S. Aj. 268.
in double folds or layers, δημός Il. 23.243: generally, twofold, double, θεσμός Orph. Fr. 247.37.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., δίπλαξ, ἡ, double-folded mantle, Il. 3.126, Od. 19.241, Lyd. Mag. 1.17: dat. pl. διπλάκεσσιν dub. l. in A. Pers. 277 (lyr.).

double, Pl. Lg. 920a, Hierocl. in CA 20p.465M., etc.: — Pass., Prodic. 7, X. Ages. 5.1, Ph. 2.534; δ. λέγεται διχῶς· ἢ γὰρ τόπον . . μένοντος τοῦ πλήθους τῶν ἀνδρῶν, ἢ τὸν ἀριθμόν Ascl. Tact. 10.17; so δ. τὸ βάθος Plb. 18.24.8.

data.quote: δ. λέγεται διχῶς· ἢ γὰρ τόπον . . μένοντος τοῦ πλήθους τῶν ἀνδρῶν, ἢ τὸν ἀριθμόν

children.definition: reduplicate, A.D. Pron. 62.23, al.:— Pass., Id. Synt. 237.23.

children.label: b
children.definition: double a consonant, Hdn.Gr. 2.932, etc.
repeat a metrical phrase, in Pass., Aristid. Quint. 1.24.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be twice the size of, τινός D.S. 4.84; to be doubled in value, Lys. 32.25.
= sq., τῶν ἀνδρῶν Ascl. Tact. 10.17; τῆς χώρας Nicom. Ar. 1.13.
doubling, Antipho Soph. 75; τοῦ κύβου Pl. Sis. 388e; τοῦ στερεοῦ Plu. QConv. 2.718f.

children.label: II
children.definition: the Ionic doubling of consonants, as in τόσσος, EM 68.47, Eust. 73.3, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: reduplication, A.D. Synt. 323.6.

children.label: III
children.definition: doubling of front, Ascl. Tact. 10.18, etc.; of Numbers, ib. 17, etc.

children.label: IV
children.definition: cross-action of muscles, Gal. 18(2).974.

children.label: V
children.definition: PHolm. 1.39.
of or for doubling, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 756.24.

definition: διπλασιεπιδίμοιρος [ δῐμ], ον, Gaud.Harm. 10, and διπλᾰσι-επιδῐμερής, ές, Nicom. Ar. 1.23,

children.definition: 2 2/3 times as great:

definition: διπλασιεπιδίτριτος, ον, Nicom. Ar. 1.23, Domnin. in Rev.Phil. 7.90,

children.definition: 2 2/3 times as great:
2 1/6 times as great:
2 1/5 times as great:
2 1/4 times as great:

definition: διπλασιεπιτετραμερής, ές, Nicom. Ar. 1.23, and διπλᾰσι-επιτετράπεμπτος, ον, ibid.,

children.definition: 2 4/5 times as great:
2 3/4 times as great:
2 3/4 times as great, Nicom. Ar. 1.23:

definition: διπλασιεπίτριτος, ον, Nicom. Ar. 1.22, Theo Sm. p.110H.,

children.definition: 2 1/3 times as great:
2 1/2 times as great.
ratio of 5 / 2, Theo Sm. p.110H.
repetition of words, Pl. Phdr. 267c.
to be doubled, Th. 1.69, PLeid.X. 87.
with two sides twice as long as the other two, κλίνη Arist. Mech. 856a39.

definition: διπλάσιος [ ᾰ], α, ον, Ion. διπλ-ήσιος, η, ον,

children.definition: twofold, double, Hdt. 4.68, etc.: never in Trag. ( δίκρουν is prob. in A. Fr. 152): freq. as Comp. folld. by ἤ . . Hdt. 6.57, Th. 1.10, etc.; also διπλήσιον ἢ ὅσον . . Hdt. 7.23: or c. gen., twice the size of, Id. 6.133; δ. ἐγίνετο αὐτὸς ἑωυτοῦ Id. 8.137; διπλάσια τῶν ἄλλων D. 18.238; δ. τῆς ἀληθείας Philem. 160; διπλασίοις ἐλάττω (sc. τὰ χρήματα) D. 27.52.
Subst. διπλήσιον, τό, as much again, Hdt. 7.103: as Adv., διπλάσιον σπεύδουσι Thgn. 229.
διπλασίαν (sc. ζημίαν) , πράττεσθαι Pl. Lg. 762b; τὴν δ. καταδικάζειν Lex ap. D. 24.105.
Adv. -ως Th. 8.1, Men. 645; δ. ἄμεινον Aeschin. 2.122, AP 7.611 ( Eutolm.).

definition: διπλασίων, ον, gen. ονος, later form for διπλάσιος, Arist. Pr. 923a3, Mu. 399a9, Arr. Tact. 16.11, PLips. 64.31 (iv A. D.), etc.; δ. λόγος

children.definition: duplicate ratio, Ph. 1.22, Plu. Mus. 2.1138e.
Eust. 1396.52, prob. l. in Plot. 6.1.9.
a measure of two πλέθρα, IG 9(1).693.20 (Corc.).
two πλέθρα long or broad, Theopomp.Hist. 350, Luc. VH 1.16.
Subst. δίπλεθρον, τό, space of two πλέθρα, Plb. 34.12.4.
double, τὰν διπλείαν τᾶς τιμᾶς Leg.Gort. 6.42, cf. GDI 4982. δίπλειον, τό, PPetr. 2p.42.
with two fronts, Ael. Tact. 36.4, Arr. Tact. 28.4.

definition: διπλῆ, ἡ, ( διπλοῦς) a marg. mark used by Gramm. [see printed copy], to indicate vv. Il., rejected verses, etc., and, in dramatic poetry, a new speaker, Cic. Att. 8.2.4, Heph. Poëm. p.74C., Sch. Il. Oxy. 1086 ii 55, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: a dance, Poll. 4.105, Hsch.

children.label: III
children.definition: διπλαῖ, αἱ, = δίπλωμα, IG 14.1054 b: also sg., PSI 5.446 (ii A. D.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: Ap.Ty. Ep. 3.

definition: διπλῇ ( Dor. διπλεῖ Tab.Heracl. 1.109, Leg.Gort. 2.7), Adv.

children.definition: twice, E. Ion 760, cj. in S. Ant. 725.

children.label: II
children.definition: twice as much, opp. ἁπλῇ, IG 1(2).6.47; folld. by ἤ, Pl. R. 330c.
Poll. 7.47.
double in quantity, Nic. Al. 153 (v.l. διπλήρης).

definition: διπλήσιος, η, ον, Ion. for διπλάσιος.

children.definition: of two bricks in height, θυρίδας διπλίνθους IG 2(2).463.55.
with double cloak, Cerc. 1.3.
fold, doubling, Gal. 2.710: but usu.,

children.label: II
children.definition: porous substance between the double plates in the bones in the skull, Hp. VC 1, 17, Heliod. ap. Orib. 46.9.4, Ruf. Onom. 135: generally, spongy core of bone, Paul.Aeg. 6.77; also, tissue between layers of intestine, Aret. SD 2.9: hence,

weak spot, flaw in metal, Pl. Sph. 267e, Ph. Bel. 71.28, Plu. Praec. 2.802b: metaph., αἱ δ. τῆς ψυχῆς QConv. ib. 715f, cf. Virt.mor. 441d; ‘patchiness’, Plot. 5.2.1; also, concealed sense, in oracles, Plu. Pyth. 2.407c.

children.label: III
children.definition: hollow sting of the scorpion, Ael. NA 9.4.
with geminate leaves, of the stone-pine, Dionys. Av. 1.27.
Dim. of διπλοΐς I, Poll. 7.49.
A. Ag. 835; cf. ἐπιδιπλοίζω.
double cloak, LXX 1 Ki. 2.19, J. AJ 6.14.2, etc.; worn by Cynics, AP 7.65 ( Antip. (?)).

children.label: II
children.definition: Hp. Morb. 2.23.
abscess in horseʼs ear, Hippiatr. 17.
double equation, Dioph.p.96T.
= Lat. duplicarius, receiving double pay, PGrenf. 2.51.5 ( ii A. D., -κάρις Pap.).
measure of wine in Egypt, Ostr. 1166, al., POxy. 1751.3 ( iv A. D., -μον Pap.).

definition: διπλόος, η, ον, contr. διπλοῦς, ῆ, οῦν, Ion. fem. διπλέη Hdt. 3.42 codd., but διπλήν or -ῆν Id. 5.90, διπλάς or -ᾶς Id. 3.28: contr. always in Trag., exc. διπλόοι A. Fr. 39: (cf. ἁπλόος):—

children.definition: twofold, double, prop. of cloaks and articles of dress, χλαῖνα διπλῆ, = δίπλαξ or διπλοΐς, Il. 10.134, Od. 19.226; ὅθι . . διπλόος ἤντετο θώρηξ where the cuirass met [the buckle] so as to be double, Il. 4.133; τὴν ἐπωμίδα πτύξας διπλῆν having folded it double, Apollod.Car. 4: generally, καλύβη διπλῆ διαφράγματι Th. 1.133; διπλόος θάνατος Hdt. 6.104; παῖσον διπλῆν (sc. πληγήν) S. El. 1415; δ. οἰκίδιον of two stories, Lys. 1.9; διπλῆ ἄκανθα spine bent double by age, E. El. 492; διπλῆ <ῥάχις> X. Eq. 1.11; σύμβολον δ. executed in duplicate, PHib. 1.29 (iii B. C.).
διπλῇ χερὶ θανεῖν by mutual slaughter, S. Ant. 14.
δ. ὀνόματα compound words, Arist. Po. 1459a9, Rh. 1404b29, etc.
δ. ἀμφημερινός, τριταῖος, Gal. 7.472, 9.677.
δ. ἰσότης, = διπλοϊσότης (q. v.), Dioph.p.98T., etc.
δ. ἄνδρας· τὰ δισύλλαβα ἀνδρῶν ὀνόματα, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Comp., twice as much, large, etc., βίος Pl. Ti. 75b; δίκη Id. Lg. 865c; δ. ἢ . . twice as much as . . (v. διπλῇ): c. gen., Id. Ti. 35b; διπλοῦν ὀφείλειν ὅσον . . Lex ap. D. 23.28; διπλῷ, = διπλῇ, Pl. Lg. 722b.

children.label: IV
children.definition: double, doubtful, οὐ γνώμᾳ διπλόαν θέτο βουλάν Pi. N. 10.89; διπλᾶς καὶ ἀμφιβόλους λέξεις Ph. 1.302.
double-minded, treacherous, E. Rh. 395, etc.; οὐδὲν δ. X. HG 4.1.32; δ. καὶ ποικίλος D.H. Rh. 11.5; also, playing two parts, Pl. R. 397e; at variance with oneself, ib. 554d.

children.label: V
children.definition: διπλοῦν, τό, = δίπλωμα III, Androm. ap. Gal. 13.29, al.
spelt with ρρ, Tz. H. 12.636.

definition: διπλός, ή, όν, poet. for διπλόος (cf. ἁπλός), Opp. C. 2.449, AP 10.101 ( Bianor): Comp. διπλότερος,

children.definition: App. Praef. 10, Ev.Matt. 23.15.
with double meaning, Sch. Ar. Nu. 225:—also διπλό-σημος, ον, Eust. 1356.60.

repeat a process, Arist. APo. 91a21; double, τρίβωνα, of philosophers, D.L. 6.22; multiply by two, Vett.Val. 159.27:— Pass., ἐδεδίπλωτο ἡ φάλαγξ X. HG 6.5.19; of swords, to be bent double, Plu. Cam. 41; of a bow-string, Ach.Tat. 3.8; of fevers (cf. διπλοῦς), Gal. 7.472; δεδιπλωμένον ἔμβρυον, of position of foetus at birth, Aspasia ap. Aët. 16.22, cf. Sor. 2.55.

children.label: II
children.definition: repay twofold, δ. διπλᾶ κατὰ τὰ ἔργα αὐτῆς Apoc. 18.6.

data.quote: δ. διπλᾶ κατὰ τὰ ἔργα αὐτῆς

children.definition: recur, τῶν διατόνων καθʼ ἕκαστον τετράχορδον διπλῳδουμένων Theo Sm. p.93H.
anything double: hence of the parallel streams of the ‘milky way’, Arist. Mete. 346a24; of ‘doubled’ position of foetus at birth, Sor. 2.60, Philum. ap. Aët. 16.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: folded paper: hence, letter of recommendation, esp. passport, Cic. Att. 10.17.4, Fam. 6.12.3; later, order enabling a traveller to use the public post, Plu. Galb. 8, OGI 665.25 ( Egypt, i A. D.), etc.; receipt for payment of licences or taxes, PAmh. 2.92 (ii A. D.), etc.
duplicate, counterpart, CIG 3276 ( Smyrna).
δ. ὄνων, tax in Egypt, BGU 213 (ii A. D.); δ. ἵππων PAmh. 2.92.21 (ii A. D.).

children.label: III
children.definition: double pot for boiling unguents, etc., Dsc. 2.77, Crito ap. Gal. 13.37.
compounding of words, Arist. Rh. 1406a6.

children.label: II
children.definition: doubling, μήνιγγος Gal. UP 9.6 (pl.); esp. in Alch., δ. ἀργύρου Zos.Alch. p.183B., cf. PHolm. 2.18, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: folding, Eust. 633.20, Hsch. s.v. πτύξις.
with two breathing apertures, Gal. 19.93 ( δίπνος codd.); cf. δίπνοια τρώματα· εἰς κενὰ τραύματα, Hsch.
two feet long, broad, etc., X. Oec. 19.3.
two-footedness, Arist. PA 643a3, Plot. 6.3.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: a Lacedaemonian dance, Cratin. 162.

children.label: III
children.definition: combination of two feet, Anon. Oxy. 220 viii 1, Heph. 4.3, Aristid.Quint. 1.24, etc.
dance the διποδία, Ar. Lys. 1243.
Hsch.
of or through two cities, φήμη Man. 4.376.

definition: Διπολίεια, τά, contr. from Διιπ-, an ancient

children.definition: festival of Zeus Polieus at Athens, IG 1(2).188,843; Διιπόλεια codd. in Ar. Pax 420, Antipho 2.4.8, cf. Sch. Ar. l.c.; Διπόλεια Hdn.Gr. 2.493.
of or divided into two cities, Str. 3.4.8, 14.2.15.
citizen of two cities, Man. 5.291.
like the feast of Dipolia, old-world, Ar. Nu. 984.
twice-ploughed, Procl.ad Hes. Op. 460.

children.label: II
children.definition: A. Fr. 209 (dub.).
with two roads or openings, δ. κορυφὰν ἴσθμιον E. Tr. 1097 (lyr.).
Pythag. ap. Iamb. VP 25.144.
between two rivers, πόλις E. Supp. 621 (lyr.).

definition: δίπους, ποδος (acc. δίπουν IG 2.1054.24, etc.), ὁ, ἡ, neut. πουν,

children.definition: two-footed, A. Ag. 1258, Supp. 895 (lyr.), Pl. Plt. 276c, etc.: δίποδα, τά, two-footed animals, Plu. QConv. 2.636e.
δίπους, ὁ, jerboa, which springs from its two hind feet, Hdt. 4.192.

children.label: II
children.definition: two feet long, γραμμή Pl. Men. 83d; διάμετρος δυνάμει δ. Id. Plt. 266b.
two-faced, ἄγαλμα Hdn. 1.16.2; ποτήριον, σκάφιον, IG ΙΙ(4).1308, 1309 ( Delos, ii B. C.).
ambiguous, Luc. JTr. 43.
denoting two persons, A.D. Pron. 17.1, 110.24.
διπρόσωπος, ἡ, name of a plaster, Gal. 11.127.

definition: δίπρῳρος, ον, ναῦς δ. καὶ δίπρυμνος a ship

children.definition: double-prowed and double-sterned, i. e. a twin ship, Callix. 1, Promathidas ap. Ath. 11.489b (here perh., = ἀμφίπρῳρος).
two-winged, of insects, opp. τετράπτερος, Arist. HA 490a16, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ δ. (sc. ναός) temple with double peristyle, Vitr. 3.2.7.

definition: διπτέρυγος, ον, = δίπτερος 1, AP 5.150 ( Mel.), cf. 9.570 ( Phld.).

children.label: II
children.definition: δ., τό, mantle with two πτερά (cf. πτερόν III.9), IG 2.754.38, Jahresh. 16 Beibl. 53.
measure (perh., = 1/2 μέδιμνος), Hsch.
Arist. HA 515b8.
fold, double, Hsch. ( -διξον cod.).

double-folded, doubled, δίπτυχον ἀμφʼ ὤμοισιν ἔχων . . λώπην Od. 13.224 (so δίπτυχα λώπην, metaplast. acc. as if from δίπτυξ, A.R. 2.32); δ. δελτίον a pair of tablets, Hdt. 7.239; δ. κάτοπτρον folding mirror, BGU 717.12; κωδίκιλλοι δ. ib. 326ii 15 (ii A. D.):—in the Homeric phrase δίπτυχα ποιήσαντες [τὴν κνίσην], δίπτυχα is interpr. by Sch. BT as an Adv., having doubled the fat, i. e. putting one layer of fat under the thighs ( μηροί) and another over them, but may be acc., = fold, Il. 1.461, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: twofold, δ. δῶρον E. Ion 1010; γλῶσσα Id. Tr. 286: in pl., = δισσοί, two, δ. ὀδύναι S. Fr. 152; νεανίαι E. IT 242, cf. Or. 633, Andr. 578, Ar. Fr. 558.

children.label: III
children.definition: δίπτυχα, τά, = Lat. tabulae, SIG 827 i 9 ( Delph., ii A. D.).
having one form for two cases, A.D. Pron. 91.7.
double-gated, with two entrances, S. Ph. 952.

children.label: II
children.definition: δίπυλον, τό, a name for the Θριάσιαι πύλαι at Athens, Plb. 16.25.7, Plu. Per. 30; at Rome for the temple of Janus, Id. Fort.Rom. 2.322a.
Hsch.
with two wings, POxy. 247.23 (i A. D.), PLond. 2.348 (iii A. D.), etc.:—also δι-πυργιαία, POxy. 1703.12 (iii A. D.).
with two knobs: Subst. -πύρηνον, τό, probe, Herophil. ap. Sor. 2.85, Cael.Aur. CP 3.3, Gal. 2.574, al.
twice-baked bread, biscuit, Hp. Int. 25.
twice fired, i.e. baked, = foreg., Eub. 18, Alex. 172.10: pl., Alc.Com. 5; δ. σῖτος JHS 32.154.

children.label: II
children.definition: διπύρους ἀνέχουσα λαμπάδας . . Ἑκάτα Hecate holding up two flaming torches, Ar. Ra. 1361.
with two horses, ἅρμα ( Ἄρης cod.) Hsch. s.v. συνωρίδα.
Dsc. 3.119: δίρκαιον, τό, = δαῦκος, Ps.- Dsc. 3.72; = στρύχνον ὑπνωτικόν, Id. 4.72. δίρκος, ὁ, = φθείρ III, Paus.Gr. Fr. 131.
with two stripes, Arist. Fr. 294.
Ar. Eq. 613, etc.
double pole, A. Fr. 324.
with two poles, i. e. three horses, A. Pers. 47 (anap.).

twice, doubly, with Nouns, δ. τόσσον twice as much, Od. 9.491, cf. Th. 6.57, etc.; ἀληθὴς ὁ λόγος ὡς δ. παῖς γέρων Cratin. 24; δ. παῖδες οἱ γέροντες Theopomp.Com. 69: more freq. with Verbs, τοῦτο δ. ἤδη ἐγένετο Hdt. 8.104; δ. φράσαι A. Pers. 173, cf. Ag. 1384; δ. αἰάζειν καὶ τρίς S. Aj. 432; δ. καὶ τρίς φασι καλὸν εἶναι τὰ καλὰ λέγειν Pl. Grg. 498e, cf. Phlb. 60a, Emp. 25; δ. βιῶναι twice over, Men. 223.4; δειπνεῖν . . δ. τῆς ἡμέρας Pl.Com. 207; ἐς δ. App. Mith. 78: ὁ δ. Νέωνος, = son and grandson of N., GDI 3092.18 ( Aegosthena); Αὐρήλιος Αὐξάνων δ. BCH 17.249 ( Apamea); Αὐρ. Δοῦ<ρ>λος δ. JHS 19.301 (Selmea [Lycaonia]).—In compds. δι-, but δισ- in δισμύριοι, δισχίλιοι, δισθανής, δίσαβος, δισάρπαγος, δίσευνος, etc. (Cf. Skt. dvis ‘twice’, Lat. bis.)

data.quote: ἀληθὴς ὁ λόγος ὡς δ. παῖς γέρων
δ. καὶ τρίς φασι καλὸν εἶναι τὰ καλὰ λέγειν

children.definition: ἄλλυδις, οἴκαδις, χαμάδις.
Rhinth. 14; otherwise only in oblique cases, Διός, Διΐ, Δία (pl. Δίες, Δίας, Plu. Def.orac. 2.425e): the contr. dat. Δί SIG 35, Pi. N. 1.72, etc.: apocop. acc. Δί in νηδί, v. Ζεύς.

definition: δίσαβος [ ῐ], ον, hyperdor. for δίσηβος,

children.definition: twice young, AP 15.26 ( Dosiad.).
saddle-bag, panniers, PFay. 347 (ii A. D.), PStrassb. 37.17 (iii A. D.):— Dim. δῐσακκ-ίδιον, τό, POxy. 741.2 (ii A. D.).

definition: δίσαλα ἀκαθαρσία, and δισαλέος· ῥυπαρός, Hsch. (cf. δεῖσα, etc.).

children.definition: twice ravished, Lyc. 513.
cubits long, Tz. H. 3.942.
fourteenth, Tz. H. 9.781.
second cousins, Asp. in EN 184.26.

definition: δισέκτωρ, dub. sens. in Stud.Pal. 20.75i22 (iii/iv A. D.).

children.definition: great-nephew, Sch. A.R. 3.359.
with two wives, AP 15.26 ( Dosiad.).
of two times, πούς Aristid.Quint. 1.14 (but in Music, of four times, acc. to Elias in Cat. 189.9).

children.label: II
children.definition: of doubtful quantity, Sch.D.T. p.38H.

children.label: III
children.definition: of two time-units, χρόνος, μέγεθος, Aristox. Rhyth. 2.10, 31, cf. Aristid.Quint. 1.14.

children.label: IV
children.definition: with double border, PTeb. 406.17 (iii A. D.), POxy. 1051.5 (iii A. D.).
twice dead, Od. 12.22.
eat two meals a day, Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 9.13.
Hsch.

definition: δισκάριον, τό, Dim. of δίσκος, Orib. Syn. 7.44.1.

children.definition: comet, Lyd. Ost. 10a, 15a.
one who pitches quoits, Mich. in EN 487.31.
Sosith. 3, Philostr. Ep. 7; δ. αὑτόν D.L. 1.118, Porph. Chr. 48:— Pass., to be pitched or thrown, AP 9.14 ( Antiphil.), v.l. in E. Ion 1268; cf. sq. [δισκέω]

pitch the quoit, δίσκον . . στιβαρώτερον οὐκ ὀλίγον περ ἢ οἵῳ . . ἐδίσκεον ἀλλήλοισιν Od. 8.188; μακρὰ δισκήσαις having made a long throw, Pi. I. 2.35; αἴ τις δισκίοι IG 5(1).828 ( Sparta):— Pass., to be hurled, of a person, E. Ion 1268 (v.l. -ευθήσεται); of a squid, AP 9.227 ( Bianor).

data.quote: δίσκον . . στιβαρώτερον οὐκ ὀλίγον περ ἢ οἵῳ . . ἐδίσκεον ἀλλήλοισιν

children.definition: a thing thrown, δ. πικρόν, of Astyanax, E. Tr. 1121.

children.label: II
children.definition: quoit-throw, S. Fr. 380.
two-sceptred, τιμή, of the Atridae, A. Ag. 43 (anap.).
pitch the quoit, Gal. Thras. 33, Hsch. s.v. δισκεύει: throw down like a quoit, Epigr.Gr. 336 (Alexandria Troas).
quoit-throwing, Gal. 6.325.
quoit-thrower, subject of statues, by Myron, Luc. Philops. 18; by Naucydes, Plin. HN 34.80.
quoit-shaped, Agatharch. 105, Dsc. 2.156, Placit. 2.27.3, Ruf. Anat. 16.
to be made in the form of a disk, Lyd. Ost. 6.
double-dyed Korax (with play on κόραξ), Luc. Pseudol. 30.
quoit, Il. 2.774, Od. 8.186, E. IA 200, al., Arist. Fr. 533, etc.; δίσκου οὖρα quoitʼs cast, Il. 23.431; λιθίνοις ἐν δ. Pi. I. 1.25.

children.label: II
children.definition: anything quoit-shaped:
dish, trencher, AP 11.371 ( Pall.), Lib. Decl. 30.24; salver, BGU 388ii22 (ii/iii A. D.).
round mirror, AP 6.18 ( Jul.).
disk, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.46, Placit. 2.24.1, al.
gong, S.E. M. 5.28, al.
reliquary, Procop. Aed. 1.7.

children.label: III
children.definition: marigold, Calendula arvensis, Alex.Trall. 12. (Cf. δικεῖν.)
quoitʼs cast, as a measure of distance, ἐς δίσκουρα λέλειπτο Il. 23.523:—also δισκ-ούρια, Hsch.
bringing the discus, Luc. Philops. 18.
of twenty thousand inhabitants, Str. 12.7.3.
twenty thousand, Hdt. 1.32, Pl. Ion 535d: sg., δισμύριος, α, ον, with collective Nouns, ἵππος δισμυρία Luc. Zeux. 8.
twice a περιοδονίκης (q. v.), κῆρυξ IG 3.129 (iii A. D.).
of two spans’ length, Dsc. 2.156.
double spondee, Heph. 3.3, Aristid.Quint. 1.22, Hermog. Id. 1.6.
sow twice, PEdgar 27.2 (iii B. C.), Str. 16.4.2 ( Pass.).
twice over, Arat. 968, Q.S. 2.56, AP 6.223 ( Antip.).
joint-ruling, δισσάρχαι βασιλεῖς S. Aj. 390 (lyr.).
at two points, Arist. de An. 406b32.

definition: δισσαχοῦ, Att. διττ-, Adv. = foreg., Thphr. Lap. 25.

children.definition: bear doubly, i. e. to be both viviparous and oviparous, Arist. GA 719a14.
dittography, repetition of words by copyist, Simp. in Cat. 88.24.
say twice, repeat, as in phrases like ἄπιστʼ ἄπιστα, καινὰ καινά, Sch. E. Hec. 688; go over again, Vett.Val. 249.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: call in question, leave doubtful, Simp. in Cael. 194.17.
repetition of words, Sch. Od. 1.406.
speaking two languages, Man. 5.291.
making doubtful, perplexing, Sch. S. El. 645.

definition: δισσός, Att. διττός, Ion. διξός (q. v.), ή, όν, ( δίς)

children.definition: twofold, double, Hdt. 2.44, 7.70, Pl. Tht. 198d, etc. Adv. διττῶς, opp. ἁπλῶς, doubly, in two ways, δ. [γνώριμα] Arist. EN 1095b2; δ. λέγεσθαι ib. 1096b13, al.
executed in duplicate, ἀποχή POxy. 1024.39 (ii A. D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: two, Pi. N. 1.44, Hdt. 5.40, 52, A. Pr. 957, S. Aj. 57, etc.: with a dual, δισσοὶ προάγοντε μάλιστα Iamb. Comm.Math. 25.

children.label: III
children.definition: divided, disagreeing in mind, λήμασι δισσούς ( λήμασιν ἴσους Dind.) A. Ag. 122 (lyr.).
doubtful, ambiguous, ὄνειροι S. El. 645; τὸ δ. ambiguity, Arist. Pol. 1261b29. Adv. διττῶς Id. SE 180a15.
bearing twice, Nonn. D. 5.199.

children.label: II
children.definition: δισσότοκος, ον, twice-born, of Bacchus, ib. 1.4.
of double nature, Nonn. D. 14.97, etc.
doubt, uncertainty, Phld. Rh. 1.111 S.:—also διστ-αγμός, ὁ, Agatharch. 21, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.214f, Steph. in Hp. 1.59 D.
two stadia long, διάστημα App. Hann. 37.

definition: διστάζω, fut. -άσω Phld. Sign. 1, al.: ( δίς):—

children.definition: doubt, hesitate, abs., Pl. Tht. 190a, Ion 534e, etc.; δ. εἰ . . Id. Lg. 897b, BGU 388i17 (ii/iii A. D.); μή . . Pl. Sph. 235a; μή ποτε, c. ind., Phld. Sign. 13, 21; πῶς . . Arist. EN 1112b2; πότερον . . Id. Metaph. 1091a14; περί τι Id. EN 1112b8; περί τινος Plu. Adul. 2.62a:— Pass., to be in doubt, D.S. 17.9; τὰ -όμενα OGI 315.66 ( Pessinus), Phld. Lib. p.23 O.
expressive of doubt, ἔγκλισις, of the subjunctive, Sch.D.T. p.245H., cf. A.D. Synt. 264.18. Adv. διστακτι-κῶς Sch. E. Or. 632, Sch. Il. 1.100.
of twice the value, Pl. Hipparch. 231d, Aglaïas 19.
Thphr. Metaph. 31, Sch. Od. 2.276.
second story, Poll. 4.130.
of two stories, οἰκία, πύργος, Sammelb. 5246 (i B. C.), POxy. 243.15 (i A. D.), cf. Str. 15.3.8, J. BJ 5.4.3, Sor. 1.70, etc.
of two chambers on the same floor, J. BJ 5.5.4.
δίστεγον, τό, room on the upper floor, Gp. 8.25.1.
twice-crowned, Call. Sos. 7.2.
Ar.Byz. Epit. 120.9.
double row or line, of fruit, J. AJ 8.3.4; of ships, Sch. Il. 14.31.
couplet, distich, Heph. Poëm. 1, Sch. Ar. Nu. 1348.

children.label: II
children.definition: growth of a second row of eyelashes, Gal. 14.767.
Sever. ap. Aët. 7.68, Paul.Aeg. 6.8.
with two rows, κριθαί Placit. 5.10.2.
of two verses, ἐπίγραμμα AP 9.369 ( Cyrill.); δίστιχον, τό, distich, AP 6.329 ( Leon.); ‘a couple of lines’, of a brief letter, FGiss. 20.23 (ii A. D.).

dividing of the hoofs, Ph. 1.321:
cloven-hoofed, Hdt. 2.71; δ. ἔμβασις E. Ba. 740:—freq. in Dor. form δίχᾱλος, Arist. PA 663a31, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: with two pincers, prongs, or claws, πυραγρέτης AP 6.92 ( Phil.); πάγουρος ib. 196 (Stat. Flacc.), cf. Hero Bel. 76.10; δίχιλα (sic) ξύλα BGU 37.4 (i A. D.); εἰς δίχηλον διεσχισμένος Hero Spir. 1.28.

children.label: III
children.definition: Subst., δίχηλα ὕεια pigs’ trotters, Luc. Lex. 6; cf. διχάλα.
dividing in twain, κύκλος . . μηνὸς διχήρης, of the moon, E. Ion 1156.

definition: διχθά, Adv., Ep. for δίχα, δ. δεδαίαται they are parted

children.definition: in twain, Od. 1.23; δ. δέ μοι κραδίη μέμονε my heart is divided, Il. 16.435.
twofold, double, κῆρες Il. 9.411, 14.21; δ. κατὰ κῶλον in either leg, APl. 16.15; simply, two, AP 6.4 ( Leon.), al.

definition: διχθάς, άδος, ἡ, fem. of foreg., Musae. 298.

children.definition: with two coats, ἀρτηρίαι Gal. 4.728:—also δῐχίτωνος, ον, Id. 19.366.
of different counsel, adverse, Νέμεσις Pi. O. 8.86.
to differ in opinion, X. Mem. 2.6.21, D.C. 44.25; δ. πρὸς ἑαυτόν Iamb. ap. Stob. 2.33.15.
doubt, Lib. Decl. 43.43.
ambiguous, Sch. E. Or. 890.
discord, Poll. 8.153.
divided between two opinions, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.11c. Adv. -γνωμόνως Poll. 8.154.
write in two ways, St.Byz. s.v. Δώτιον ( Pass.).
Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.82.
from both sides, both ways, A. Pers. 76 (lyr.), Ar. Pax 477, Th. 2.44, etc.; δ. μισθοφορεῖν D. 24.123; from two sources, τὸ δίκαιον δ. συνίσταται Aps. Rh. p.294H.
wavering, cj. in Pittac. 1 Bgk.
tax of two χοίνικες per ἄρουρα, PLond. 372.25 (ap. PTeb. ii p.339) (ii A. D.), etc.

definition: διχοινίκιος, ον, = sq., PSI 1.33.18 (iii A. D.).

children.definition: holding two χοίνικες, Ar. Nu. 640.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. διχοίνικον, τό, measure of two χ., SIG 945.4 (pl., Assos, iv B. C.).
with double gall, Ael. NA 11.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: at variance, πόλις cj. in Alc. 37 A; δ. γνῶμαι, = διάφοροι, Achae. 39.
doubly furious, v.l. for τριχόλωτος, ἀνάγκη AP 9.168 ( Pall.).
Arat. 78, cf. 737.
full moon, IG 1(2).6.62, PRev.Laws 56.18 (iii B. C.), LXX Si. 39.12, Gem. 8.1, etc.; δ. μηνὸς Μεταγειτνιῶνος Inscr.Prien. 4.45 (iv B. C.); ἡ σελήνη δ. ἦγεν Plu. Dio 23.
mid-menstrual period, Hp. Oct. 13.
day of full moon, Gal. 9.908; also, = Lat. Idus, Suid.
= sq., Μήνα Pi. O. 3.19, cf. A.R. 4.167; δ. ἑσπέραι evenings at the full of the moon, Pi. I. 8(7).47; νύξ B. 8.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἡμέρα, = Lat. Idus, D.H. 1.38, etc.
dividing the month, i.e. at or of the full moon, ἑσπερίη h.Hom. 32.11; δ. σελήνη Gp. 10.48.2, cf. Plu. Flam. 4; διχόμηνος, ἡ, Arat. 808, Ph. 2.293; διχομήνη, ἡ, Gp. 2.14.7, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.173.
double-speaking, νόημα Pittac. 1 Bgk.; γλῶσσα Sol. 42.4; double-dealing, deceptive, Ant.Lib. 23; λέγειν διχόμυθα speak ambiguously, E. Or. 890.
indicating doubt, Eust. 166.28. Adv. -κῶς discordantly, Gloss.
discord, disagreement, Pl. Alc. 1.126c, Plu. Adul. 2.70c; δ. περὶ τοῦ ἀρίστου Ph. 2.181: c. gen., disagreement with, τῆς Ἀντωνίου γνώμης App. BC 5.33.
double-minded, Ph. 2.269, cf. 663.
productive of division, opp. ἑνοποιός, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 58.11.
two-stringed, πηκτίς Sopat. 11:— Subst. δί-χορδον, τό, Euphro 1.34.
ditrochaeus, Longin. 41.1.
division of a chorus into two parts, Poll. 4.107, Arg. Ar. Lys. 1.
sing in two halves, of a chorus, Hsch.
broken in twain, E. HF 1008 (lyr.).
oscillating, γνώμη Trag.Adesp. 341. Adv. -πως waveringly, doubtfully, used only by A., and always with a neg., οὐ or μὴ δ. Ag. 349, 815, 1272, Supp. 605, 982.
dissension, B. 10.67 (pl.), Hdt. 5.75, Eus.Mynd. 45, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.20c; sedition, Sol. 4.38, Thgn. 78, LXX 1 Ma. 3.29.
stand apart, disagree, ὄξος τʼ ἄλειφά τʼ . . διχοστατοῦντʼ ἂν οὐ φίλως προσεννέποις A. Ag. 323; δ. λάχη Id. Eu. 386 (lyr.); λόγος S. Fr. 867; δ. πρός τινα E. Med. 15, Pl. R. 465b.

δορὸς πλᾶκτρον S. Fr. 152.

punish with the last severity, Ev.Matt. 24.51.
divide into two (logically), Pl. Plt. 302e, Arist. PA 642b22, 644b19.
Plu. Fac.lun. 2.929f.
half of a thing cut in two: hence, generally, any portion of a thing cut up, LXX Ex. 29.17, Le. 1.8, Ph. 1.503 (pl.).
= sq., κύκλου S.E. M. 9.284.
dividing in two, of the moonʼs quarters, Arist. GA 777b22, Gem. 9.3, Simp. in Ph. 455.22; bisection, Theo Sm. p.184H.
point of bisection, Archim. Aequil. 1.6, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: division into two parts (logically), dichotomy, Arist. PA 644a9, Iamb. Comm.Math. 1.

definition: διχοτομιαῖος, α, ον, = sq., Paul.Al. G. 4.

children.definition: cutting in two, Ammon.p.44V.: but,

children.definition: διχότομος, ον, cut in half, divided equally, μυκτήρ Arist. HA 492b17; δ. σελήνη the half-moon, Id. Pr. 911b36, Aristarch.Sam. Hyp. 3, Gem. 9.8, prob. in Plu. Fac.lun. 2.929f; σελήνης σύμβολον τὸ δ. Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.11; μέχρι διχοτόμου till the second quarter, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.3.2; κατʼ ἀμφοτέρας τὰς διχοτόμους (sc. φάσεις) at the first and third quarters, Ptol. Alm. 5.1.
Hdt. 4.120, Choer. in Theod. 1.388.

definition: δίχους [ ῐ], ουν, neut. pl. δίχοα,

children.definition: holding two χόες, Posidon. 25 J., Arist. Ath. 67.2; δίχουν, τό, Dsc. 5.57.
to hold different opinions, Plu. Amat. 2.763e.
discord, faction, Plu. Praec. 2.824d (pl.), Ocell. 4.6, D.Chr. 44.10, Anon. ap. Iamb. VP 7.34.
at variance, πότμος δ. a destiny full of discord, A. Th. 899 (lyr.).
forked, Gal. 14.707.
disease of the hair, when it splits, Gal. 19.430.
disagree, Pythagorei ap. Iamb. in Nic. p.73P.
discord, Iamb. VP 7.34.
Hp. Oss. 10.
double colour, Arist. GA 751a32.
two short syllables, Sch.Heph. p.110C.

children.definition: Pythag. name for six, Theol.Ar. 37.
of two quantities, common, D.H. Comp. 14, Plu. QConv. 2.737e, S.E. M. 1.100; περὶ διχρόνων, title of treatise by Hdn.Gr.

children.label: II
children.definition: consisting of two short syllables, [ πούς] Heph. 3.1, cf. Arc. 139.20: metaph. of the pulse, Ruf. Syn. Puls. 4.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: equivalent to two time-units, Longin. Proll.Heph. p.87C.
two-coloured, ᾠά Arist. HA 489b14, GA 749a18.

definition: δίχρωμος, ον, = foreg., Luc. Prom.Es 4, Gal. 13.460.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. δίχρωμος, ἡ, name of a plaster, Aët. 15.13.
δίχρωμον, τό, = περιστερεὼν ὕπτιος, Ps.- Dsc. 4.60.
measure of wine in Egypt, = eight χόες, BGU 531 ii 5 (i A. D.), etc.
doubly, in two ways, A. Ch. 915 (dub.), Arist. Mu. 393a24, Ascl. Tact. 10.10; in two senses, Arist. Po. 1457a28.
thirst, δ. τε καὶ λιμός Il. 19.166; πεῖνα καὶ δ. Pl. R. 585a; δίψῃ ξυνέχεσθαι Th. 2.49, etc.; of trees, Antiph. 231.6, PFlor. 176.12 (iii A. D.): pl., Arist. EN 1154b3.
thirst for, ποτοῦ Pl. R. 437d: metaph., ἀοιδᾶν δ. Pi. P. 9.104.—The form δίψη occurs in Opp. C. 4.339, and in codd. of A. Ch. 756; cf. δίψος.
βλάψαι, Hsch.; cf. δίψιος I. fin.
thirsty, EM 801.48; expld. by ταλαίπωρον, Hsch.
diabetes, attended with violent thirst, Gal. 8.394, Alex.Trall. 11.6.

thirsty, μῦς Batr. 9; ἀνήρ Call. Jov. 27, cf. AP 9.128; ἐπιθυμία Ph. 1.116; δ. θρυαλλίδιον wanting oil, Luc. Tim. 14; ὀδύνη δ. the pain of thirst, Id. Dips. 6; ὄργανα δ. subject to thirst, Aret. SA 2.4.
dry, parched, ἀήρ A.R. 4.678, Nonn. D. 22.260, al.

children.definition: thirst-provoking, χοῖρος AP 9.487 ( Pall.).

definition: διψάρα δέλτος, οἱ δὲ διφθέρα, Hsch.

children.definition: δίψιος, βοτάναι Euph. 141; χῶραι J. BJ 3.3.4, cf. Opp. C. 4.322, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., venomous serpent, whose bite caused intense thirst, Nic. Th. 334, Ael. NA 6.51; δ. ἔχιδνα AP 7.172 (Antip. Sid.), IG 4.620.4 ( Argos).
δ. ἄκανθα a desert thorn, Acacia tortilis, Thphr. HP 4.7.1.

definition: διψάω, late Ep. διψ-ώω Tryph. 548, AP 11.57 ( Agath.): Ion. διψ-έω Archil. 68; part. διψεῦσα AP 6.21; contr. 3 sg. διψῇ Pi. N. 3.6, Pl. Phlb. 35b; inf. διψῆν Hdt. 2.24, S. Fr. 735, Ar. Nu. 441, etc.: impf. 3 sg. ἐδίψη Hp. Epid. 3.1.βʹ, γʹ ( διψᾷς, -ᾷ, -ᾶν only in later writers, APl. 16.137 ( Phil.), Pl. Ax. 366a, LXX Is. 29.8, Gal. 5.837): fut. -ήσω X. Mem. 2.1.17: aor. ἐδίψησα Pl. R. 562c: pf. δεδίψηκα Hp. Cord. 2, Plu. Pomp. 73:— Med. (v. infr.):—

children.definition: thirst, στεῦτο δὲ διψάων [ᾱ] Od. 11.584, etc.; of the ground, to be thirsty, parched, Hdt. 2.24; δ. ὑπὸ καύματος Alc. 39.2; of trees, Thphr. CP 3.22.5:— Med., διψώμεθα Hermipp. 25.

δ. τινός thirst after a thing, Pi. N. 3.6; ἐλευθερίας Pl. R. 562c: later c. acc., δ. Χῖον Teles p. 8 H.; φόνον APl. 16.137 ( Phil.); δικαιοσύνην Ev.Matt. 5.6; αἷμα J. BJ 1.32.2; also δ. πρὸς τὸν θεόν LXX Ps. 41(42).2: c. dat., ὕδατι ib. Ex. 17.3: c. inf., διψῶ χαρίζεσθαι ὑμῖν X. Cyr. 5.1.1; ἀκρατῶς ἐδίψη οἴνου πίνειν Ael. VH 2.41, etc.

definition: διψηρός, ά, όν, = δίψιος, Hp. Aër. 7; [ οἶνος] Posidipp. 34 (s. v. l.):—also διψ-ήρης, ες, Nic. Th. 371.

children.definition: a thirst, longing, Ath. 1.10b; cf. δίψα.
thirsty, Arist. PA 671a2.
provoking thirst, ὁ φόβος -κόν Id. Pr. 947b39: Comp., Dsc. 1.128.

definition: δίψιος, α, ον, also ος, ον A. Ch. 185, Nic. Th. 147: ( δίψα):—

Th. 7.87 codd., X. Cyr. 8.1.36, Pl. Phd. 94b, Nic. Th. 774, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 28, etc., v.l. for δίψα in Ar. Eq. 534, Th. 4.35. (Sch. Il. 19.166 calls δίψος Attic, δίψα Ionic; both forms in LXX, cf. Wi. 11.4, 8; δίψος 2 Ep.Cor. 11.27.)
Porph. ap. Eus. PE 6.2.
double-minded, Ph. 2.663, Ep.Jac. 1.8.
thirsty, Hp. Aph. 4.54, Plu. Sanit. 2.129b, Aret. SA 2.4; τοῦ πάθους τὸ μανικὸν καὶ δ. Plu. Vind. 2.555e.

definition: δίω [ῐ], Ep. Verb (used also by A. in lyr. passages, v. sub fin.), only pres. and impf. Med. (of which Hom. has subj. δίωμαι, δίηται, δίωνται, opt. δίοιτο Od. 17.317, but mostly inf. δίεσθαι; for δίον v. δείδω):—

children.definition: put to flight, δηΐους προτὶ ἄστυ δίεσθαι Il. 12.276; [ μητέρα] ἀπὸ μεγάροιο δίεσθαι Od. 20.343; μή σε . . ἀγρόνδε δίωμαι βάλλων χερμαδίοισι 21.370; ὡς δʼ ὅτε νεβρὸν . . κύων . . δίηται Il. 22.189; ἐπεί κʼ ἀπὸ ναῦφι μάχην . . δίηται 16.246; rarely, drive, ὅς τʼ . . ἵππους . . προτὶ ἄστυ δίηται 15.681; also in A., ἀτίετα διόμεναι λάχη pursuing a dishonoured office, Eu. 385 (lyr.); and intr. folld. by Prep., give chase, hunt, ἐπὶ τὸν ὦ διόμεναι ib. 357 codd. ( ὧδʼ ἱέμεναι Ahrens); μετά με δρόμοισι διόμενοι Id. Supp. 819; f. l. for δίεμαι, Id. Pers. 700.

weighing two obols, Archig. ap. Gal. 13.264, etc.
double obol, Ar. Fr. 3, Alex. 186, Theopomp.Com. 55, Arist. Ath. 41.3.

pursuit, chase, A. Eu. 139 (pl.), Plb. 1.34.9, Onos. 10.6 (pl.); δ. πώλων, = τοὺς διώκοντας πώλους, E. Or. 988; ὑπʼ ἀετοῦ δ. φεύγων Id. Hel. 20; δ. ξιφοκτόνον, i. e. the sword, ib. 354; τὰ πλούτου δ. eager pursuit of wealth, Pl. Plt. 310b.

pursuit, D.S. 4.13, al., Ael. Tact. 34.4, Iamb. VP 31.191.

with thrilling anguish, σπαραγμός S. Tr. 777.

definition: διωθέω, aor. διῶσα Hom. (v. infr.), διέωσα X. HG 2.1.8, ἐδίωσα codd. in Hero Aut. 24.3:—

push from oneself, push away, τοῖς κόντοις διεωθοῦντο, of sailors, Th. 2.84; ἡ γαστὴρ δ. τὸ περιττὸν εἰς τὴν νῆστιν Gal. 5.567; repulse, στρατὸν ἰθυμαχίῃ Hdt. 4.102; οἷς [πέτροις] . . διώσει στρατόν A. Fr. 199.9 (Dobr.); κῆρας Democr. l.c.; τὰς τύχας E. HF 315; ψευδῆ λόγον καὶ συκοφαντίαν repel it, D. 21.124; τὴν ἐπιβουλήν Id. 58.65: abs., get rid of danger, Hdt. 9.88.

scuffle, jostle, App. BC 2.117.
pushing about, scuffle, Plu. Cam. 29 (pl.).
διώκω and read in Pl. Euthphr. 15d, E. Fr. 362.25 codd. Stob.: the remaining forms may be referred to an aor. διωκαθεῖν· Subj. διωκάθω Ar. Nu. 1482: 2 sg. ἐδιώκαθες Pl. Grg. 483a, etc.

to be pursued, Pl. Tht. 167d, etc.
